Salute to Unity : A Heartfelt Tribute to Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, Architect of United India.

Tributes to Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel on his 138th birth anniversary :
first Deputy Prime Minister and Home Minister of independent India and regarded as the "Bismarck of India" and "Iron Man of India", was born on Oct 31, 1875, in a small village in Nadiad.


Iron man of India :  Integrating 500+ odd princely states each with their own agenda into one nation is not a joke, that speaks of Sardar Patel's greatness. "The problem of states is so difficult, that you alone can solve it"- Gandhi to Sardar Patel on integration of India.

The IAS, IPS, IFS were set up under the Indian constitution, which was in accordance with Sardar Patel's vision. It was Sardar Patel's vision that the Civil Service should strengthen cohesion and national unity. The values of integrity, impartiality and merit remain the guiding principles of Indian civil services.

It's True that the British did come up with Civil Services in India first, but the current Civil services we have in India was Sardar Patel's vision. However it's Questionable that we Indians make his Vision in to reality Properly? because Sardar Patel, won the admiration and respect of bureaucrats, for the way he backed them, listened to them, gave them freedom. This was a total negation of Sardar Patel’s ideal of an impartial civil service, immunised from undue political influence and, therefore, in a position to give advice without fear and favour and to administer without bias. When Sardar Patel passed away in 1950, 1500 civil servants attended his funeral, to pledge complete loyalty to service of nation.

Watch Video: Remembering Sardar Patel on his birth anniversary: http://youtu.be/lSAiuF2n0K8

Happy Birth Day to the Iron Man of India " Sardar Patel "
